sentences.text: We are furnishing you this proxy statement in connection with the solicitation of proxies by our Board of Directors (Board) to be voted at the 2017 xAnnual Meeting of  Stockholders (Annual Meeting of xAnadarko Petroleum Corporation, a Delaware corporation, sometimes referred to herein as the Company xAnadarko, us, we or like terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  xAnnual Meeting will be held on Wednesday May 10, 2017, at 3:00 a.m. (Central Daylight Time).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy materials, including this proxy statement, proxy card or voting  nstructions and our 2016 annual report, are being distributed and made available on or about March 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our stockholders access to our proxy materials on the Inter  net (https://materials.proxyvote.eom/0 32 511).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xAccordingly a Notice of Internet Avail ability of Proxy  Materials (Notice) will be mailed to most of our stockholders on or about March 24,2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders will have the ability to access the proxy materials on the website referred to in the N otice or request a printed set of the proxy materials to be sent to them by foil owing the instructions in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also provides instructions on how to inform us whether to send future proxy materials to you electronically by e-m ail or in printed form by m ail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to  receive future proxy materials by e-mail, you will receive an e-mail next year with instructions containing a link to those materials and a link to the proxy voting site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election  to receive proxy materials by e-mail or printed form will rem ain in effect until you terminate it
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive future proxy m aterials by e-mail will allow us to provide you with the inform ation you need in a more timely manner, save us the cost of printing and  mailing documents to you, and conserve natural resources.

sentences.text: Our Restated C ertificate of Incorporation provides that all directors are to be elected annually and that any director (or the entire B oard) m ay be removed with or without cause at and after the Annual Meeting at which he or she is elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the xArmual Meeting, the terms of our thirteen incumbent directors will expire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Twelve of those thirteen directors have each been nominated to stand for election and, if  elected at the Annual Meeting will hold office until the expiration in 2013 of each of their one-year terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is not aware of ary reason why the director nominees would not be able to serve as directors of the C om pany.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: H o  wever, if a nominee is unavailable for election,  hen the proxies will be voted for the election of another nominee proposed by the Board or, as an alternative, the Board may reduce the number of directors to be elected at the  xAnnual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws provide for the election of directors by the majority vote of stockholders in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means the number of votes cast for" a nominees  election must exceed the number of votes castagainsf such nominees election in order for him or her to be elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each incumbent nominee is required  to provide an irrevocable letter of resignation stating that he or she will resign if that director does not receive the required majority vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a director were to fail to receive a  majority of votes cast and the Board were to accept the resignation tendered, then that director would cease to be a director of xAnadarko.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the twelve incumbent director  nominees has submitted an irrevocable letter of resignation that becomes effective if he or she does not receive a majority of the votes cast for his or her election and the Board  decidesto accept such resignation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail on page 16 of this proxy statem ent, the B oard considers several qualifications, characteristics and other factors when evaluating individual  directors, as well as the composition of the Board as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xAspart of this process, the Board and its Governance and Risk Committee review the particular experiences,  qualifications, attributes and skills of each nominee to determine if that person should serve as a director of the Comp ary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The biographies of each of the nominees contain  information regarding the persons experience and director positions held currently or at ary time during the last five years, and inform ation regarding involvem ent in certain legal  or administrative proceedings, to the extent applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also highlight the particular experiences, qualifications, attributes or skills that caused the Governance and Risk  Committee and the Board to conclude that the person should be nominated to serve as a director of the Company

sentences.text: BOARD AND COMMITTEE GOVERNANCE Our Board recognizes that excellence in corp
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes that excellence in corporate governance is essential in carrying out our responsibilities to our stakeholders, including our stockholders, employees,  customers, communities, and creditors, as well as to the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines, By-Laws, Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, CodeofEthicsfor  the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and ChiefxAccounting Officer, and written charters for the Audit Committee, the Compensation and Benefits Committee  (Compensation Committee), and the Governance and Risk Committee, all as amended from time to time, can be found on the Companys website at http://www.anadarko.com/responsibility/good-governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These documents provide the framework for our corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xAny of these documents will be furnished in prin free of charge to ary stockholder up on request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can submit such a request to the Corporate Secretary at 1201 Lake Robbins Drive, The Woodlands, Texas 77330-1046.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Company's Corporate Governance Guidelines, directors are expected to attend regularly scheduled Board of Director meetings and meetings of committees on  which they serve, as well as the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each incumbent director who served on our Board during 2016 attended at least 75% of the meetings of the Board  and the committees on which he or she served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were six Board meetings and a total of 20 Board committee meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all of the incumbent directors  attended the 2016 xArmual Meeting of Stockholders (2016 xArmual Meeting), other than Mr. Constable, who joined the Board in July 2016, Ms. Farley, who joined the Board in  February 2017, and Mr. George.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE The Board believes that the combined
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) role ensures open communication between the Board and executive management and  promotes consistent and effective leadership of both the Board and executive management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board believes that a combined Chairman and CEO role is currently the  best approach to promote long-term stockholder value for the reasons listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Walker was initially elected Chairman of the Board effective foil owing the Comparys 2013  xAnnual Meeting and has been re-elected to such role each year since that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xA s the Companys CEO, Mr. Walker works in concert with the rest of our majority-independent  Board and the independent Lead Director, Ms. Eberhart, to oversee the execution of the Companys strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Promotes Unified Approach on Corporate Strategy Development and Execution  Maintaining a combined position enables the C ompanys CEO to act as a bridge  between management and the Board, helping both to act with a common purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This also fosters consensus building and alignment on strategy and tactical execution  of a B oard- approved vision and strategy at the top levels within the C ompany.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requires that the CEO Recognize Importance of Good Corporate Governance  Maintaining a combined position requires that the CEOs responsibilities include a  mastery of good corporate governance, a focus on broad stakeholder interests, and an open channel of communication, and requires the CEO to work together with the  Lead Director as a team and to appreciate the vital importance of good governance practices in executing the Comparys strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides Clear Lines of  Accountability  A  combined position has the practical effect of simplifying the accountability of the executive managem ent team, thereby  reducing potential confusion and fractured leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides dear Roadmap  fo r Stockholder/Stakeholder Communications  A  combined position provides the C ompanys stakeholders the opportunity to deal with a  single point of overall authority, which we believe results in more efficient and effective communications with stakeholders.

sentences.text: Consistent with industry be st practices, the Board has a strong and active Lead Director whose duties and responsibilities ensure the Comp ary  maintains a corporate governance structure with appropriate independence and balance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent Lead Directors duties are closely aligned with the role of an independent,  non-executive chairman Ms. Eberhartwas appointed as Lead Director effective February 9,2016.

sentences.text: x^s the Lead Director, elected ex clusively by the independent directors, Ms. Eberharts role is to assist the Chairman and the remainder of the B oar d in assuring effective corporate governance in m anaging the affairs of the B oard and the C ompany.

sentences.text: Ms. Eberhart, who has previously served as Chair of the Audit C ommittee and currently serves as Chair of the G overnance and Risk C ommittee, serves as a liaison between the  Chairman and the independent directors and works with the Chairman to approve all meeting agendas.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE RISK ASSESSMENT The Compensation Committee reviewed a comprehensi
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed a comprehensive compensation risk assessment conducted independently by Frederic W Cook & Co., Inc. (FWCook), the  Compensation Committees executive compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assessment focused on the design and application of the Companys executive and non-executive compensation programs and whether such programs encourage excessive risk taking by executive officers and other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the outcomes of this assessment and the Compensation  Committees review, the Compensation Committee believes that the C om panys compensation programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) do not motivate our executive officers or our non-executive employees  to take excessive risks,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) are well designed to encourage behaviors aligned with the long-term interests of stockholders, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) are not reasonably likely to have a material  adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xAnadarkos compensation programs are designed to support and reward appropriate risk taking and include the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an appropriate balance of fix ed versus variable pay, cash and equity py components, operating and financial perform ance m easures, short-term and long-term  performance periods, extended vesting schedules, and established formulas and discretion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: established policies to mitigate compensation risk including significant stock ownership guidelines for officers of the Company insider-trading prohibitions, clawback  provisions, and specified caps on incentive awards; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: independent Compensation Committee oversight, which also extends to incentive plans below the executive officer level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominee Seiection Process The Companys Corporate Governanc
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines require that with respect to Board vacancies, the Governance and Risk Committee (or a subcommittee thereof):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) identify  the personal characteristics needed in a director nominee so that the Board as a whole will possess such qualifications as more fully identified below;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) compile, through such  means as the Governance and Risk Committee considers appropriate, a list of potential director nominees thought to possess the individual qualifications identified in the Corporate  Governance Guidelines, as well as any additional specific qualifications the Board deems appropriate at the time;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) engage an outside consultant, as necessary, to assist in the  search for qualified nominees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) review the background, character, experience and temperament of each potential nominee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) conduct interviews, and if appropriate recommend  that other members of the Board and/or management interview such potential nominee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) evaluate each potential nominee in relation to the culture of the Company and the  Board, which emphasizes independent thinking and teamwork.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stated in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, one of the core competencies our Board has identified in assessing the qualifications of the Board  as a whole is a diversity of experience, professional expertise, perspective and age.

sentences.text: The Board recognizes that such diversity is an important factor in board composition and the  Governance and Risk Committee ensures that such diversity considerations are discussed in connection with each candidate for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the past several years, our Board has  reviewed a director skill set chart that identifies expertise, experience and other characteristics that the Board believes contribute to an effective and well-functioning board and that  he Board as a whole should possess.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for determining the type and amount of compensation for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is reviewed annually to ensure  that it is appropriately designed to attract qualified individuals who possess the expertise and skill set required by the Company's Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting non- employee director compensation, the Compensation Committee considers the competitive market as well as the significant amount of time that non-employee directors spend in fulfilling their duties to the Comp ary and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist in the 2016 annual review of director compensation, the Compensation Committee directly retained FW Cook as its outside  independent compensation consultant to provide benchmark compensation data and recommendations for compensation program design
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors receive a combination of cash and stock-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Compensation Committee adopted an amendment to the  *Anadarko Petroleum Corporation 2002 Director Compensation Plan to limit the total compensation, both cash and stock-based compensation, that non-employee directors may  receive annually under any of the Comp arys compensation plans.

sentences.text: As part of its annual review of executive  compensation in November 2016, for the third consecutive year the Committee determined that the target total compensation opportunity for the executive officers (other than for  two recently appointed ex ecutive officers) should rem ain substantially flat year-over-year and that no changes should be made to the current base salaries, target bonus  opportunities, and target grant value of annual long-term incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Walkers target total compensation opportunity has remained the same since his appointment to CEO  in May 2012, at which time the C ommittee positioned him at the m edian of CEO s of our industry peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C ommittee believes that the pay opportunity provided by the  current levels of fixed and at-risk compensation components (1) properly refle cts the scope and responsibilities associated with each executive officers position, (2) is appropriately  aligned with the industry peer group and (3) serves to retain and motivate a highly experienced and cohesive executive team to successfully manage the operations of a global  company of our scope and complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a robust stockholder  engagement  program and, based on  feedback received, have made several  changes to our executive compensation  program and governance practices over  the years, including the changes to the  AIP  fo r 2016 and 2017 discussed on  pages 30 -31.

sentences.text: We regularly engage with our stockholders,  reaching out specifically to the governance and voting teams, to solicit feedback on *Anadarkos executive compensation  programs, as well as corporate governance, sustainability and environmental issues and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2012, we have held  more than 140 separate engagements with our stockholders as well as several meetings with proxy advisory firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  stockholder engagement team consists of senior management from our Hum an Resources, Legal, Investor Relations, and Health, Safety and Environment departments and has also included the chair of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of our engagem ent team also  participate in various governance forums with our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally reach out to our top 50 stockholders each spring  and fall, with engagement also occurring at other times throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders  views on executive compensation  and corporate governance are important to us, and we value and use their feedback and insights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its committees regularly discuss and consider the significant concerns that are identified through this engagement process as well as the outcome of the annual  dvisory vote on executive compensation.

sentences.text: The Committee made changes to the AIP  for  2016 and 2017 based on stockholder  feedback to improve and strengthen the  alignment of  the program with stockholder  interests.

sentences.text: Impact of Divestitures and Variance with Guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the Committee approved the 2016 AIP  performance goals, the Company intended to monetize certain non-core assets throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the uncertainty  regarding both the timing and execution of these divestitures, the assets were initially included in the Com panys budget as  well as the AIP targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee excluded the effects of the asset divestitures closed during the year by  removing them from the AIP targets, performance results and the calculated performance score.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This was done to ensure  that neither the timing nor execution of the divestiture program had any impact on the final AIP performance score.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a  result of this methodology, the target performance goals differed from the Companys initial public guidance provided at  the beginning of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION FOR 2016 The Company maintains a Deferred Compensation Plan for certain employees, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Plan, certain employees may voluntarily defer receipt of up to  75% of their salary and/or up to 100% of their AIP payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not match these deferred amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, deferred amounts are distributed to the participant  upon separation from service or at a specific date as elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time deferral elections are made, participants also elect to receive their distributions in either  lump-sum or annual installments not exceeding 15 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to IRC limitations that restrict the amount of benefits payable under the tax-qualified 401(k) Plan, the Company sponsors a non-qualified Savings Restoration Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Savings Restoration Plan accrues a benefit equal to the excess, if any, of Company matching and PWA contributions that would have been allocated to a participants 401(k) Plan  account each year without regard to IRC limitations over amounts that were, in fact, allocated to a participants account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a participant reaches the IRC limitations under the  401(k) Plan, the Company makes contributions on their behalf up to the six-percent match on eligible compensation they would have otherwise been entitled to receive under the  401(k) Plan and, if applicable, an additional four percent of eligible compensation for PWA participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible compensation includes base salary and AIP bonus payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  general, deferred amounts are distributed to the participant in lump-sum upon separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the Deferred Compensation Plan and the Savings Restoration Plan permit participants to allocate the deferred amounts among a group of notional accounts that mirror the gains and/or losses of various investment funds provided in the 401(k) Plan (but excluding the Company stock fund).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These notional accounts do not provide for above-market or  preferential earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each participant directs investments of the individual accounts set up for the participant under the plans and may make changes in the investments as often as  daily.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since each executive officer chooses the investment vehicle or vehicles (including a selection of funds ranging from fixed income to emerging markets, as well as other  equity, debt and mixed investment strategies in between) and may change their allocations from time to time, the return on the investment will depend on how well each underlying  investment fund performed during the time the executive officer chose it as an investment vehicle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate performance of such investment is reflected in the Aggregate  Eamings/Losses in 2016 column.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers were given the opportunity to make voluntary deferral elections for all of their annual restricted stock unit and performance unit awards granted under the  Companys 1999 Stock Incentive Plan and the 2008 and 2012 Omnibus Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any earnings and/or losses attributable to the deferred shares otherwise payable under these awards  are based on the performance of the Companys stock over the deferral period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, deferred awards are distributed to the participant, in the form of Company common stock  or cash, as designated by the Compensation Committee at the time of grant, upon termination or at a specific date as elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not subsidize or  match any deferrals of compensation into these plans.

sentences.text: The following tables reflect potential payments to our NEOs under existing contracts, agreements, plans or arrangements, whether written or unwritten, for various scenarios  involving a change of control or termination of employment of each NEO, assuming a termination date of December 31, 2016, and, where applicable, using the closing price of our  common stock of $69.73 (as reported on the NYSE as of December 30, 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following are general definitions that apply to the termination scenarios detailed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These definitions have been summ arized and are qualified in their entirety by the  full text of the applicable plans or agreements to which our NEOs are parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Involuntary Termination is generally defined as any termination that does not result from the foil owing termination events: resignation; retirement; for cause; death; qualifying  disability, extended leave of absence; continued failure to perform duties or responsibilities; a termination in connection with any corporate sale transaction where continued  employment is available; or a termination if the NEO is eligible to receive benefits from a Key Employee Change-of-Control Contract, or under an employment or severance  agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Cause is generally defined as the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the willful and continued failure of the executive officer to perform substantially the executive officers duties with the Company or one of its affiliates (other than any such failure resulting from incapacity due to physical or mental illness) or material breach of ary material provision in an employment agreement (if applicable), after  written dem and for substantial perform ance is delivered to the executive officer by the B oard or the CEO of the C ompany which specifically identifies the m anner in  which the Board or CEO believes that the executive officer has not substantially performed the executive officers duties; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the willful engaging by the executive officer in illegal conduct or gross misconduct which is m aterially and demonstrably injurious to the C ompany
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A  Change of Control is generally defined as any one of the following occurrences:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ary individual, entity or group acquires beneficial ownership of 20% or more of either the outstanding shares of our common stock or our combined voting power;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individuals who constitute the B oard (as of the date of either a given change-of- control contract or an award agreem ent under our equity plans, as applicable) cease to  constitute a m ajority of the B oard, provided that an individual whose election or nomination as a director is approved by a vote of at least a maj ority of the directors as  of the date of either the change-of-control contract or an award agreem ent under our equity plans, as applicable, will be deemed a member of the incumbent Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good Reason is generally defined as any one of the following occurrences within three years of a Change of Control:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: diminution in the executive officers position, authority, duties or responsibilities that were effective immediately prior to the Change of Control, excluding for this  purpose an isolated, insubstantial and inadvertent action not taken in bad faith and which is remedied by the Company promptly after receipt of notice thereof given by  the executive officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any failure by the Company to provide compensation to the executive officer at levels that were effective immediately prior to the Change of Control, excluding for this purpose an isolated, insubstantial and inadvertent action not taken in bad faith and which is remedied by the Company promptly after receipt of notice thereof given by  the executive officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any material change in the location, as defined in the applicable agreement, where the executive officer was employed immediately preceding the Change of Control,  the Company requiring the executive officer to travel on Company business to a substantially greater extent than required immediately prior to the Change of Control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any termination by the executive officer for any reason during the 30-day period immediately following the first anniversary of a Change of Control (such occurrence is not part of the good reason definition under Mr. Walkers Severance Agreement or under the Key Employee Change of Control Contracts with Messrs. Ingram and  Leyendecker);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any purported termination by the Company of the executive officers employment otherwise than as expressly permitted in their Change-of-Control, Employment or  Severance Agreement; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any failure by the Company to require any successor (whether direct or indirect, by purchase, merger, consolidation or otherwise) to assume the terms provided in the  executive officers Change-of-Control or Employment or Severance Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cotri party re cognizes that related-person transactions can present potential or actual conflicts of interest and it is the C otri panys preference that related-person transactions  are avoided as a general matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However the Company also recognizes that there are situations, including certain transactions negotiated on an arms length basis, where related-  person transactions maybe in, or may not be inconsistent with, the best interest of the Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Compary has written procedures for the  approval, ratification and review of ongoing related-person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Either the B oards Governance and Risk C ommittee or the full B oard (as determined by the Governance  and Risk Committee) will review, ratify or approve, as necessary, ary related-per son transactions prior to the transaction being entered into, or ratify ary related-person transactions  that have not been previously approved, in which a director, five-percent owner, ex ecutive officer or imm ediate family member of any such person has a m aterial interest, and where  the transaction is in an amount in excess of $120,000, either individually or in the aggregate of several transactions during any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review typically occurs in  c onne cti on wi  th re gul arly sche dul e d B oar d m e etings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to those m atters described above, the G overnance and Risk Committee has approved in advance the following categories of related-person transactions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the rates  and term s involved in such transactions where the C omparys standard rates and terms for such transactions apply; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the hiring of a related person (including imm ediate  family members) as an employee of the Comp ary (but not an officer), provided that total annual compensation (meaning base salary, annual incentive bonus and other amounts to  be reported on a W-2) does not ex ceed $120,000.

sentences.text: Independent Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the work of the independent auditor employed by the Company and  establishes guidelines for the retention of the independent auditor for ary permissible services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In performing these responsibilities, among other things, the Audit Committee  (1) reviews the qualifications, performance and independence of the independent auditor, (2) reviews and evaluates the lead partner of the independent auditor having primary  responsibility for the Comp arys audit and ensures the rotation of such partners as required by law, and (3) considers whether the audit firm should be rotated in order to maintain  the independence between the independent auditor and the C ompany.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointedKPMG LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm, to audit the Companys consolidated financial statements for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  B oard believes that the continued retention of KPMG LLP to serve as the C ompanys independent auditor is in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders and at the  request of the Audit C ommittee, is asking you to ratify that appointm ent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: determination of the independent auditor for 2017.

sentences.text: The xAudit Committee adopted a Pre-xApproval Policy with respect to services which may be performed by KPMG LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy lists specific audit and audit-related  services that KPMG LLP is authorized to perform and sets out specific dollar limits for each specific service, which may not be exceeded without additional Audit Committee  authorization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee receives quarterly reports on the status of expenditures pursuant to that Pre-xAppr oval Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The xAudit Committee reviews the policy at least annually in order to approve services and limits for the current year, xAny service that is not clearly enumerated in the policy  must receive specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee or by its Chair, to whom such authority has been conditionally delegated, prior to engagement During 2016, no fees for  services outside the scope of audit, review, or attestation that exceed the waiver provisions of 17 CFR 210.2-01(c)(7)(i)(C) were requested of or approved by the Audit Committee.

sentences.text: Advisory Vote to Approve  Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 3 -A D VISO R Y VOTE TO APPROVE THE COMPANYS NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection *A ct of 2010, along with section 14A of the Exchange *Act enacted thereunder, enables our stockholders to vote  to approve, on anon-binding advisory basis, the compensation of the Comparer's NEOs, as disclosed in this proxy statement pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes the importance of our stockholders opportunity for an advisory say-on-pay vote as a means of expressing views regarding the compensation practices and  programs for our NEO s.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C ompany has held an advisory say- on-pay vote at our annual m eeting of stockholders every year since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in detail in the Letter from the Chair of the Compensation Committee on page 29 and under the heading Compensation Discussion and x^nalysis beginning on  page 30, the Compensation Committee believes that the main objective of our executive compensation programs is to py for performance and align executive officers interests  with stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We structure pay to support our business objectives with appropriate rewards for short-term operating results and long-term stockholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Accordingly, our compensation philosophy recognizes the value of rewarding our executive officers for their performance and m otivating them to continue to excel in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting, our executive compensation program received the support of approximately 62% of the votes cast Based on specific feedback expressed by  tockholders during outreach efforts, the Compensation Committee commissioned FW Cook to develop and present a thorough analysis outlining various design alternatives to  address stockholder concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sought an appropriate balance tobest serve the interests of our stockholders while continuing to attract and retain the  alent necessary to achieve the Companys strategic goals, taking into account standards in our industry and peer group and the appropriate decisions for our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following  extensive discussions regarding the merits and issues associated with various design alternatives, in February 2017 the Compensation Committee approved changes to the AIP for  2016 and 2017 in response to stockholder feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive compensation earned and paid to our NEOs and the decisions made by the Compensation Committee in 2016 and 2017, including changes made in consideration of stockholder feedback, reflect the pay-f  or-performance alignment of our compensation programs and adherence to our compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reduced the cap for each AIP performance goal payout from 275% to 200% for the 2016 and 2017 AIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This provides balance in the  overall payout curve and m ore evenly balances the weighting of the performance goals, preventing a higher bonus payout for strong achievement on only a few goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C ompensation C ommittee flattened the payout curve on certain 2017 AIP performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reserve Additions and C apital Expenditures, by requiring a wider  range of performance to exceed target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This reduces the volatility and unpredictability of outcomes in setting target performance and requires higher absolute  performance to achieve above target payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee added an additional financial goal to the 2017 AIP, Cash Operating I ncome/BOE, with a weighting of 25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C ompensation C ommittee modified the form of change- of-control contract used for newly appointed ex ecutive officers, whether or not they were subject to an  existing agreement prior to their appointment, to reduce the severance multiple from 2.9 to 2.5 and other changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of second-quarter TSR performance for the three-year performance period ended December 31, 2016, the NEOs earned a 123% payout (out of a maximu 200% ).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee strategically set the 2016 AIP performance goals to enhance returns and increase stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Company's strong  operating and financial performance in 2016 despite the challenging commodity market, the NEOs were awarded above-tar get bonuses equivalent to a 153%  performance score to recognize their successful execution of the Companys strategic goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Future  Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 4 -  ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON THE COMPANYS NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection *A ct of 2010, together with section 14*^ of the Exchange Act enacted thereunder, enables our stockholders to  indicate how frequently we should seek an advisory vote on the compensation of the NEOs, as disclosed pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules, such as Item 3  included in this proxy statem ent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting on this Item 4, stockholders may indicate whether the advisory vote should occur every three years, every two years or every year, or  abstain on this m alter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 x^rmual Meeting of Stockholders, our stockholders voted on a proposal regarding the frequency of holding advisory votes on ex ecutive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time,  approximately 67% of our stockholders approved, on an advisory basis, an annual advisory vote on compensation for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the stockholder vote, the Board  determined that we would hold an advisory vote on ex ecutive compensation every year until the next stockholders advisory vote on this m atter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xAfter careful consideration of this Item 4, the Board has determined that an advisory vote on executive compensation that occurs every year (an annual vote) is appropriate as  described further below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holding an annual vote on executive compensation will enhance transparency and give stockholders an opportunity to express their concerns with our compensation program  other than through director elections, x^n annual vote will provide a clear, simple and effective means for us to obtain inform ation on investor sentiment about our ex ecutive  c om pensati on phil o sophy and react thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have in the past been, and will in the future continue to be, proactively engaged with our stockholders on a number of topics, including executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, we  view the advisory vote on executive compensation as an additional, but not exclusive, opportunity for our stockholders to communicate with us regarding their views on the  Companys executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on ex ecutive compensation is non-binding on the B oard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: N otwithstanding the B oards recommendation and the  outcome of the stockholder vote, the Board may in the future decide to conduct advisory votes on alternative bases and may vary its practice based on factors such as discussions  with stockholders and the adoption of material changes to our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under applicable law, the next advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory  votes on ex ecutive compensation will occur no later than the C ompanys annual m eeting of stockholders in 2023.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote on your preferred voting frequency by choosing the option of three years, two years, one year or abstain from voting when you vote in response to this  Item 4.
